subject: Real Estate
title: Eviction: The Legal Process
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Eviction: The Legal Process.

hook.text: A landlord cannot change the locks, shut off utilities, or throw belongings on the sidewalk. That's illegal.

buildup.text: Eviction requires a court order. The landlord must file a lawsuit, serve notice, and attend a hearing.

discovery.text: The process takes weeks to months depending on the jurisdiction. During that time, the tenant can stay.

twist.text: Self-help eviction â€” bypassing the courts â€” exposes landlords to criminal charges and civil liability.

climax.text: The legal eviction process protects tenants from arbitrary removal, but it also frustrates landlords owed rent.

punchline.text: Only a judge can legally remove a tenant.

quiz.question: What is self-help eviction?
options: Removing a tenant without a court order
